result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) and Operating w/PAC-Passenger <16 Yrs(2nd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) and the other charge, Operating w/PAC-Passenger <16 Yrs(2nd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Joshua D Schumacher was found guilty of OWI (2nd w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Joshua D Schumacher in court with attorney Ryan O'Hara.  Russell Edward Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented and discussed. Defendant pleads guilty to Count 1. Counts 2 & 3 - DRI. Any companion citations (if any) are to be dismissed. State makes recommendation. Defense makes recommendation.

.084 BAC

Court relates and orders: 
$1,429.00 fine including costs
12 month DL revoked
12 month IID 
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.
10 days jail with credit for 3 days. Good Time granted. Huber or work release privileges granted.
Defendant to report to jail by 1:00 p.m. today.
3 days jail credit.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 11-20-2015 11:30 am

Defendant Joshua D Schumacher in court with attorney Ryan O'Hara.  Defendant Joshua D Schumacher in custody.  Russell Edward Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
THIS COVERS 15CF71 & 15CF302. Defense relates agreement. 
15CF71 - Defendant pleads guilty to count 2. Court accepts the plea and finds the Defendant guilty. 
15CF302 - to be schedule with Branch 2. 

Felony admonitions given. 

15CF71 - PSI ordered. Bond continues. 
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 14, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191. 
Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.  
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.
Must not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.
Must not transport children in motor vehicle without another adult in vehicle.
Must submit PBT's twice daily at 6:00 a.m. and 6:00 p.m. at the Rice Lake Police Department.
